src.main¶

Driver class - you should be able to run main from the command line along with the some command line arguments of your choice, and this script will call all other modules/scripts and feed those args/params as needed.

src.main.validate_bins_input(bins_input_int)¶

Validates the user input for number of bins

Parameters

bins_input_int – Requested number of bins.

Raises

Exception – If requested number of bins outside a specified set of values.

src.main.validate_color_input(color_input_string)¶

Validates user input for requested format for color (or lack thereof).

Parameters

color_input_string – Requested color format.

Raises

Exception – If invalid or unaccepted color format.

src.main.validate_video_file(video_file_path_string)¶

Validates that the input video file exists and is in one of the accepted formats.

Parameters

video_file_path_string – Path to video file.

Raises

Exception – If invalid file or video.

src.main.validate_width_input(width_input_int)¶

Validates the user input for width.

Parameters

width_input_int – Description

Raises

Exception – If requested width outside a specified range.

src.stream_cameras_and_histograms¶

How to grab and process images from multiple cameras using the CInstantCameraArray class. The CInstantCameraArray class represents an array of instant camera objects. It provides almost the same interface as the instant camera for grabbing. The main purpose of the CInstantCameraArray is to simplify waiting for images and camera events of multiple cameras in one thread. This is done by providing a single RetrieveResult method for all cameras in the array. Alternatively, the grabbing can be started using the internal grab loop threads of all cameras in the CInstantCameraArray. The grabbed images can then be processed by one or more image event handlers.

Description.

  • example_parameter_a – Description

  • example_parameter_b – Description

An integer

abc

src.stream_cameras_and_histograms.find_devices()¶

If devices are connected to computer and number of cameras are connected , and number of devices connected is equal to or below user specified limit, this function should return list of Basler device instances. Otherwise, raises a a general Exception or a RuntimeError.

Raises

Exception – Any error/exception other than ‘no such file or directory’.

src.stream_cameras_and_histograms.get_cameras(devices, config_files, num_cameras=2)¶

Should be called AFTER and with the return value of find_devices() (as implied by the first parameter: devices)

Parameters

  • devices – An instance of tlFactory.EnumerateDevices()

  • num_cameras – An integer

  • config_files – An integer

Raises

Exception – Any error/exception other than ‘no such file or directory’.

Returns

A dictionary of cameras with ascending lowercase alphabetical letters as keys

Return type

cameras

src.stream_cameras_and_histograms.initialize_histograms(bins, num_cameras=2, line_width=3)¶

Initializes histogram matplotlib.pyplot figures/subplots

Parameters

  • devices – An instance of tlFactory.EnumerateDevices()

  • num_cameras – An integer

  • config_files – An integer

Raises

Exception – Any error/exception other than ‘no such file or directory’.

Returns

A dictionary of histograms with ascending lowercase alphabetical letters (that match cameras) as keys

Return type

histograms
